intro: Diapedium chinense, commonly known as the Chinese starwort, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant features compound leaves with a distinctive star-like appearance, giving it its common name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. Diapedium chinense is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
